title: PSG vs Inter LIVE : Champions League final latest score and goal updates | Football
body_text:
A Desire Doue masterclass helped Paris Saint-Germain land their first-ever Champions League trophy with 5-0 win over Inter Milan on Saturday.
It’s the biggest margin of victory ever in a Champions League final – with no team having won by five goals before the 2025 showdown in Munich.
PSG enjoyed a dream start when Achraf Hakimi finished off a brilliant team goal on 12 minutes, tapping in from six yards out after clever play from Vitinha and Doue providing the assist for the right-back.
Doue then got on the scoresheet himself eight minutes later, with his powerful deflected shot flying past Yann Sommer to put PSG’s passionate fans in dreamland at the Allianz Arena.
Inter needed to produce a huge comeback but there was no sign of one in the works as Doue made it three after another sensational team goal with Vitinha again involved and a no-look flick from Ousmane Dembele.
PSG were not done there as Khvicha Kvaratskhelia got in on the action, having been sent clean through by Dembele’s pass and firing past Sommer, before Senny Mayulu confirmed Inter’s humiliation by adding a late fifth.
Here’s how it all unfolded…

From the latest transfer rumours and managerial moves to analysis of the biggest games and a lot more, our experts have you covered.
Sign up here, it's an open goal.
Live Feed
This Live Blog has now ended
This blog is now closed. For the latest updates, visit Metro’s Football page.
That’s all from us!
Thanks for joining our live blog tonight. Stay with Metro for the the latest and best reaction to the Champions League final and more!
Henry and Wenger share emotional celebration
Donnarumma: Enrique gave us freedom
PSG goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma, speaking after the match, said: ‘We were almost out a few times during the season, then we managed to progress and completed an extraordinary season.
‘Our coach gave us the freedom and kept us calm. This is his philosophy. He prepared the final in the best possible way, and we saw that.’
Kylian Mbappe sends message to PSG
Kylian Mbappe has offered his congratulations to Paris Saint-Germain after their historic Champions League triumph.
The Frenchman left PSG to join Real Madrid in 2024.
Biggest margins of victory in Champions League and European Cup finals
- 2025: PSG 5-0 Inter
- 1960: Real Madrid 7-3 Eintracht Frankfurt
- 1974: Bayern 4-0 Atletico Madrid (replay)
- 1989: Milan 4-0 Steaua
- 1994: Milan 4-0 Barcelona
Enrique’s shirt in Champions League final pays tribute to late daughter Xana
Luis Enrique paid a touching tribute to his late daughter Xana after PSG beat Inter in the Champions League final on Saturday night.
‘Enrique up there with Ancelotti, Mourinho and Guardiola’
Steven Gerrard has heaped praise on PSG manager Luis Enrique.
Speaking on TNT Sports, Gerrard said: ‘Does Luis Enrique deserve to be mentioned in the same breath as Carlo Ancelotti, Jose Mourinho or Pep Guardiola? The answer is yes.
‘This team he has created and put together over the past year or two can beat you in any given way.
‘The talent across this squad – it is a special group of players and they’re getting coached by a special person as well.’
PSG lift Champions League trophy!
PSG have clinched the biggest trophy in club football!
What a night for the French side and their supporters.
PSG tifo sparks emotional scenes in Munich
Some incredibly emotional scenes after PSG’s famous and historic victory in the Champions League final.
PSG supporters have unveiled a touching tifo featuring the daughter of their manager Luis Enrique, after she passed away at the age of nine in 2019.
TNT Sports presenter Laura Woods could be heard holding back tears.
Vitinha: This means everything
‘This means everything,’ PSG superstar Vitinha just told TNT Sports.
‘It’s my dream, it’s our dream. It’s incredible.’
FULL TIME: PSG 5-0 Inter
PSG ARE CHAMPIONS OF EUROPE FOR THE FIRST TIME!!!!
Mayulu magic makes it five
87: THIS IS JUST GETTING SILLY!
Mayulu, who has been on the pitch for three minutes, makes it FIVE in the Champions League final.
He’s a 19-year-old PSG academy graduate. This is embarrassing for Inter Milan.
PSG make triple change
84: Ramos, Mayulu and Zaire-Emery all on for PSG. The players to come off are Kvaratskhelia, Ruiz and Neves.
Hernandez comes on
78: PSG bring on Hernandez to replace Mendes. Their supporters are going crazy with their team almost 10 minutes away from their first Champions League trophy.
Kvaratskhelia adds fourth for PSG
73: IT’S GETTING BRUTAL FOR INTER!
Kvaratskhelia makes it four in what is becoming a very, very one-sided contest.
He rolls a finish past Sommer after being sent clean through by Dembele’s pass.
This has got to be one of the most dominant displays in a Champions League final ever.
Two yellow cards for Inter
71: Since the third PSG goal, Inter duo Thuram and Acerbi have both been shown yellow cards. Tonight is getting worse and worse for the Italian side.
Inter have also made three more substitutions. Mkhitaryan, Bisseck and Çalhanoğlu all off. Carlos Augusto, Darmian and Asllani take their spots in the XI.
Doue taken off!
66: Enrique – what on Earth are you doing?! The PSG boss has taken Doue off and has replaced him by Barcola. No chance of a hat-trick, then…
‘Everything about this is beautiful’
TNT Sports commentator Ally McCoist was left blown away by that sensational PSG goal.
‘It has been a mismatch [tonight],’ he said. ‘This sums it up. Everything about this is beautiful.
‘The weight of the pass takes it away from the defender and Desire Doue knows he’s going to get a clean strike on it.
‘A really composed finish. As poor as Inter have been, PSG have been excellent.’
Doue finishes off incredible goal
63: DOUE HAS TWO!!!
Paris Saint-Germain have been levels and levels above Inter Milan all night and they now have a three-goal lead.
Doue assisted the first goal, netted the second and has now scored the third. A truly incredible night for the 19-year-old in Munich.
He’s booked for taking his shirt off in the celebration but he won’t care one bit.
Dembele’s no-look flick finds Vitinha and a perfect pass to Doue sees the wonderkid fire past Sommer. It’s surely all over now.
Chance for Hakimi!
61: Another chance for the French side as Hakimi fires wide. The idea of an Inter comeback is fading with every minute.
